DOCNAME: PROSSER and OTHERS v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
TEXT: In all the following cases , the Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON , ORG .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE , ORG . He is not represented before the ORG .
The applicant was widowed on DATE . On DATE , aged DATE , he made an application for survivors’ benefits , which was finally refused on DATE .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on CARDINAL DATE and lives in GPE . He is not represented before the ORG .
The applicant was widowed on DATE , when he was DATE . He subsequently claimed survivors’ benefits and was refused .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE . He is represented before ORG RDW , solicitors practising in GPE .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . There was one child of the marriage , born on DATE . The applicant made an enquiry about survivors’ benefits to ORG in DATE , and was informed by a letter dated DATE that men were not eligible for such benefits . He wrote to ORG again in DATE , asking for his claim to be reconsidered , and was informed again , on DATE , that he was not entitled .
The applicant made a formal application for bereavement benefits on DATE , aged DATE , and was refused on DATE . He appealed , and his appeal was finally rejected by ORG on DATE .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE . He is also represented before ORG RDW .
The applicant was widowed on DATE . On DATE , aged DATE , he applied for survivors’ benefits , and was finally refused on DATE .

The applicant was widowed on DATE , when he was DATE . He claimed survivors’ benefits on DATE and was finally refused at some point after DATE .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . In DATE , aged DATE , he claimed survivors’ benefits , and was finally refused on DATE .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . On DATE , aged CARDINAL , he claimed survivors’ benefits , and was finally refused on DATE .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE . He is also represented before ORG RDW .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . Shortly after his wife ’s death he made enquiries about survivors’ benefits but was told these were not available for men . On DATE , aged DATE , he claimed survivors’ benefits , and was refused DATE .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE . He is also represented before ORG RDW .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . In DATE , aged CARDINAL , he enquired about survivors’ benefits and was informed on DATE that such benefits were not available to men . He subsequently made a formal application , which was refused on DATE .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE . He is also represented before ORG RDW .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . Following his wife ’s death the applicant enquired about survivors’ benefits but was informed by ORG that men were not eligible . He made a formal application in DATE , aged DATE , to which he never received a response .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in PERSON . He is also represented before ORG RDW .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . Following his wife ’s death , he enquired about survivors’ benefits and was informed that they were not available for men . On DATE , aged DATE , he applied for survivors’ benefits , and was finally refused on DATE .
The domestic law relevant to these applications is set out in PERSON v. the GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-IV .
